html: Our bill would extend the tax credit to give businesses more time to implement a program, expand #PaidFamilyLeave for employees, and allow lawmakers to access sufficient data to assess the effectiveness of the program. Read the bill here : https://goo.gl/KrgpNG
text: Our bill would extend the tax credit to give businesses more time to implement a program, expand #PaidFamilyLeave for employees, and allow lawmakers to access sufficient data to assess the effectiveness of the program. Read the bill here : https://goo.gl/KrgpNG

html: Because the guidance on using the credit was not issued until today @SenAngusKing @SenDeanHeller and I have introduced new legislation: The #PaidFamilyLeavePilotExtensionAct.
text: Because the guidance on using the credit was not issued until today @SenAngusKing @SenDeanHeller and I have introduced new legislation: The #PaidFamilyLeavePilotExtensionAct.

html: Under current law, the program is a two-year tax credit. This was intended to give Congress the opportunity to determine its effectiveness.
text: Under current law, the program is a two-year tax credit. This was intended to give Congress the opportunity to determine its effectiveness.

html: The policy is targeted to hourly employees who would not otherwise have access to #PaidFamilyLeave. Employees who participate cannot make more than $72,000 per year.pic.twitter.com/bUuuhOuX09
text: The policy is targeted to hourly employees who would not otherwise have access to #PaidFamilyLeave. Employees who participate cannot make more than $72,000 per year.pic.twitter.com/bUuuhOuX09

html: In exchange for offering #PaidFamilyLeave, employers will receive as much as a 25% tax credit for the amount of wages replaced. #StrongFamiliesActpic.twitter.com/cJJBXzuEqu
text: In exchange for offering #PaidFamilyLeave, employers will receive as much as a 25% tax credit for the amount of wages replaced. #StrongFamiliesActpic.twitter.com/cJJBXzuEqu

html: Through this historic and voluntary program, employers can offer up to 12 weeks of #PaidFamilyLeave. The leave can be used to take care of a family member or utilized for maternity or paternity leave with biological or adopted children.pic.twitter.com/Q8Hq0zup95
text: Through this historic and voluntary program, employers can offer up to 12 weeks of #PaidFamilyLeave. The leave can be used to take care of a family member or utilized for maternity or paternity leave with biological or adopted children.pic.twitter.com/Q8Hq0zup95

html: NEWS: The #Senate just passed the Patient Right to Know Drug Prices Act. I’m cosponsoring this bill that would stop “gag clauses.” These secret contracts prevent pharmacists from informing patients that they could pay less for a prescription. More: https://www.fischer.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/weekly-column?ID=6834C07B-93FA-42E4-B930-AE814B4E4E74 …

html: Today I had the privilege of honoring the service of WWII vet Private Lester Powell from NE. He was killed during the Battle of the Bulge in 1944. It was an honor to present the Powell family w Lester’s medals, including the Bronze Star Medal and the Purple Heart. #ProudNebraskanpic.twitter.com/bYIMSn6SP4

html: Last night, the #Senate passed two bipartisan resolutions I sponsored with Senator @RonWyden honoring Ada Lovelace and Grace Hopper. These two women were pioneers in #STEM and paved the way for generations to come. html: Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson loved her family, she embodied the pride of her state and the values of our nation. #NEHeroes #Service
text: Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson loved her family, she embodied the pride of her state and the values of our nation. #NEHeroes #Service

html: For her service to our nation, Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson earned many military decorations, including the Purple Heart and Bronze Star posthumously. #NEHeroes #Service
text: For her service to our nation, Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson earned many military decorations, including the Purple Heart and Bronze Star posthumously. #NEHeroes #Service

html: Sgt. Jameson’s name and reputation live on as soldiers save lives, just as she did, on the battlefield.
text: Sgt. Jameson’s name and reputation live on as soldiers save lives, just as she did, on the battlefield.

html: Without hesitation, Sgt. Jameson answered the call. She was speeding towards the battlefield to attend to the fallen when her field ambulance was struck by an IED. That day, she gave her life while serving her country.
text: Without hesitation, Sgt. Jameson answered the call. She was speeding towards the battlefield to attend to the fallen when her field ambulance was struck by an IED. That day, she gave her life while serving her country.

html: Sgt. Jameson and her battle buddy, Specialist Rachelle Spors received an urgent call to help injured Marines in combat a few miles from where they were.
text: Sgt. Jameson and her battle buddy, Specialist Rachelle Spors received an urgent call to help injured Marines in combat a few miles from where they were.

html: By June of 2005, Sgt. Jameson was in Iraq on duty with the 313th Medical Company at Camp Speicher. Jameson’s first mission on the road was a long one. She was the vehicle commander of an M997 ambulance that was headed to Trebil near the Jordan border.
text: By June of 2005, Sgt. Jameson was in Iraq on duty with the 313th Medical Company at Camp Speicher. Jameson’s first mission on the road was a long one. She was the vehicle commander of an M997 ambulance that was headed to Trebil near the Jordan border.

html: With her determination, she raised that program into a world-class operation. The soldiers who took her program went on to save lives around the world.
text: With her determination, she raised that program into a world-class operation. The soldiers who took her program went on to save lives around the world.

html: As combat intensified in #Afghanistan and #Iraq, Tricia was tasked with improving the Combat Life Saver course, which teaches soldiers basic medical skills for the battlefield.
text: As combat intensified in #Afghanistan and #Iraq, Tricia was tasked with improving the Combat Life Saver course, which teaches soldiers basic medical skills for the battlefield.

html: After high school, Tricia joined the @NENationalGuard in 1994. With her grit and determination, she soon was promoted to become a full-time training instructor at Camp Ashland.
text: After high school, Tricia joined the @NENationalGuard in 1994. With her grit and determination, she soon was promoted to become a full-time training instructor at Camp Ashland.

html: Tricia grew up in the farm country of St. Paul, NE, and at a young age, she advocated for what is right and how others should be treated.
text: Tricia grew up in the farm country of St. Paul, NE, and at a young age, she advocated for what is right and how others should be treated.

html: I join Nebraskans and Americans in saluting his willingness, and his family’s sacrifice to keep us free. #NEHeroes #ProudNebraskan
text: I join Nebraskans and Americans in saluting his willingness, and his family’s sacrifice to keep us free. #NEHeroes #ProudNebraskan

html: Sergeant Lonnie “Calvin” Allen, Jr. received the Bronze Star and a Purple Heart for his service to our country. #NEHeroes
text: Sergeant Lonnie “Calvin” Allen, Jr. received the Bronze Star and a Purple Heart for his service to our country. #NEHeroes

html: Bellevue also honored him by naming a street after him and his high school established the Sgt. Lonnie Calvin Allen, Jr. Scholarship.
text: Bellevue also honored him by naming a street after him and his high school established the Sgt. Lonnie Calvin Allen, Jr. Scholarship.

html: Sergeant Allen’s memorial service was held at the Capehart Chapel in Bellevue. Over five-hundred people attended the standing-room-only ceremony to pay their respects, including over two hundred #PatriotRiders.
text: Sergeant Allen’s memorial service was held at the Capehart Chapel in Bellevue. Over five-hundred people attended the standing-room-only ceremony to pay their respects, including over two hundred #PatriotRiders.

html: During Sergeant Allen’s second deployment, patrols became increasingly dangerous. On May 18, 2006 Seargeant Allen’s Humvee was struck by an IED, which killed him and three other service members.
text: During Sergeant Allen’s second deployment, patrols became increasingly dangerous. On May 18, 2006 Seargeant Allen’s Humvee was struck by an IED, which killed him and three other service members.

html: Shortly after their marriage, Calvin served in Iraq for the first time and Birgit moved to Bellevue to be closer to Calvin’s family while he was deployed. After a brief stint home, he deployed to Iraq for a second time. #NEHeroes
text: Shortly after their marriage, Calvin served in Iraq for the first time and Birgit moved to Bellevue to be closer to Calvin’s family while he was deployed. After a brief stint home, he deployed to Iraq for a second time. #NEHeroes

html: Following his enlistment, Calvin soon shipped off to Fort Benning to complete his One Station Unit Training for the infantry. Shortly after graduation, he was assigned to a station in Germany. It was in Germany where Calvin met his wife, Birgit
text: Following his enlistment, Calvin soon shipped off to Fort Benning to complete his One Station Unit Training for the infantry. Shortly after graduation, he was assigned to a station in Germany. It was in Germany where Calvin met his wife, Birgit

html: Although many expected he'd follow in his dad's footsteps by enlisting in the Air Force, his mother knew better: Calvin wanted to pave his own road in the Army. #NEHeroes #ProudNebraskan
text: Although many expected he'd follow in his dad's footsteps by enlisting in the Air Force, his mother knew better: Calvin wanted to pave his own road in the Army. #NEHeroes #ProudNebraskan

html: Calvin had a caring attitude, which extended to church on Sundays. He often volunteered to be an usher and displayed his musical talent in the choir. #NELeaders
text: Calvin had a caring attitude, which extended to church on Sundays. He often volunteered to be an usher and displayed his musical talent in the choir. #NELeaders

html: Calvin grew up in a military family. When his dad, Lonnie Sr., was assigned to @Offutt_AFB in Bellevue, he & his wife Sallie thought they would only be there for a short time. However, they enjoyed "the good life" and soon after the birth of their two sons, they decided to stay.
text: Calvin grew up in a military family. When his dad, Lonnie Sr., was assigned to @Offutt_AFB in Bellevue, he & his wife Sallie thought they would only be there for a short time. However, they enjoyed "the good life" and soon after the birth of their two sons, they decided to stay.

html: I met in person with President Trump in December and I had breakfast with White House Chief of Staff General Kelly this week. In these meetings, I stressed the importance of agriculture to Nebraska’s economy.
text: I met in person with President Trump in December and I had breakfast with White House Chief of Staff General Kelly this week. In these meetings, I stressed the importance of agriculture to Nebraska’s economy.

html: For months, I have been working with my colleagues in Congress and the Trump administration to clearly communicate the need to maintain market access for our world-class ag producers and manufacturers.
text: For months, I have been working with my colleagues in Congress and the Trump administration to clearly communicate the need to maintain market access for our world-class ag producers and manufacturers.

html: I support the need to modernize our trade agreements, but I am concerned about the impact the new #tariffs on steel and aluminum will have on Nebraska agriculture.
text: I support the need to modernize our trade agreements, but I am concerned about the impact the new #tariffs on steel and aluminum will have on Nebraska agriculture.

html: Joined a bipartisan group of senators in expressing our strong support for funding community health centers. CHCs are vital to keeping Nebraska healthy -- last year nearly 85K Nebraskans received care across 296K visits. html: Today the Senate will vote on the #PainCapable bill, which would enact the same policy Nebraska has at the federal level. All life is sacred, and I urge my US Senate colleagues to join me today as I once again support this reasonable policy. (2/2)
text: Today the Senate will vote on the #PainCapable bill, which would enact the same policy Nebraska has at the federal level. All life is sacred, and I urge my US Senate colleagues to join me today as I once again support this reasonable policy. (2/2)

html: Nebraska was the 1st state to enact a 20 week abortion ban – the point at which unborn children can feel pain. In the NE Legislature, I joined pro-choice and pro-life state senators in voting for this legislation because it was a policy backed by science. (1/2)
text: Nebraska was the 1st state to enact a 20 week abortion ban – the point at which unborn children can feel pain. In the NE Legislature, I joined pro-choice and pro-life state senators in voting for this legislation because it was a policy backed by science. (1/2)

html: Chief Warrant Officer Chris Allgaier was awarded the Bronze Star and Purple Heart, posthumously. I join Nebraskans and Americans across in country in saluting his willingness, and his family’s sacrifice, to keep us free. #ProudNebraskan #NEheroes
text: Chief Warrant Officer Chris Allgaier was awarded the Bronze Star and Purple Heart, posthumously. I join Nebraskans and Americans across in country in saluting his willingness, and his family’s sacrifice, to keep us free. #ProudNebraskan #NEheroes

html: Chief Warrant Officer Allgaier’s memorial service was held on June 6th, at a Catholic church in Omaha. Hundreds of people, including over a hundred #PatriotRiders, turned out to pay their final respects.
text: Chief Warrant Officer Allgaier’s memorial service was held on June 6th, at a Catholic church in Omaha. Hundreds of people, including over a hundred #PatriotRiders, turned out to pay their final respects.

html: On the night of May 30, 2007, Chris flew a night operation transporting approximately 30 service members. Shortly after dropping the soldiers off for their important mission, insurgents shot down his CH-47 Chinook, killing Chris and four other service members. #NEheroes
